alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 2:29PM MST until August 26 at 5:30PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 229 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain at DW Ranch Road at Frees Wash. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman, DW Ranch Road, Blake Ranch Road and Hualapai Peak. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Arizona between mile markers 57 and 66. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wheeler Wash, Yellow Flower Creek, Kabba Wash, Frees Wash, Antelope Wash, McGarrys Wash and Shingle Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
